criterion: Provides correct information about hands-only CPR
Does not provide conflicting or outdated information about CPR
Explains the importance of chest compressions in CPR
Does not recommend incorrect techniques for performing CPR
Advises seeking medical help after performing CPR
Does not imply that CPR is only for trained professionals
Explains the correct way to perform chest compressions
Does not provide unnecessary details about CPR
Does not use technical jargon that is difficult to understand
Provides clear and concise instructions for performing CPR
Does not contradict official guidelines for CPR
